words.definition: If something happens altogether, it happens completely.
words.example: The company stopped using sugar altogether in its food.

words.definition: To bind is to bring people together.
words.example: The victims of the flood were bound by their need to help each other.

words.definition: A bruise is a dark mark caused by being hit by something.
words.example: She got a bruise on her knee from falling down.

words.definition: A custom is a way of doing things that has been the same for a long time.
words.example: It is a custom that the bride and groom sleep in separate places.

words.definition: When someone is disobedient, they do not follow the rules.
words.example: The disobedient child would not listen to his parents.

words.definition: To foresee something is to know about it before it happens.
words.example: The teacher did not foresee any problems with the new schedule.

words.definition: To glimpse something is to see it for a very short time.
words.example: I glimpsed a strange animal in the woods.

words.definition: A hoop is a ring that is made of plastic, metal, or wood.
words.example: The basketball player threw the ball through the hoop.

words.definition: Misfortune is bad luck or an unlucky event.
words.example: He had the misfortune of breaking his arm.

words.definition: When something is negative, it is unpleasant or bad.
words.example: She has a negative attitude about the project.

words.definition: Per is used to mean 'for each' or 'for every'.
words.example: The car can travel 30 miles per gallon of gas.

words.definition: To plead is to ask for something in an emotional way.
words.example: He pleaded with his parents to let him go to the party.

words.definition: To rip something means to pull it apart quickly.
words.example: He ripped the paper into small pieces.

words.definition: Sake is the reason for doing something.
words.example: He moved to the city for the sake of his job.

words.definition: To scrape something is to rub it against a hard surface.
words.example: I scraped my knee when I fell.

words.definition: A source is a place where something comes from.
words.example: The river is the main source of water for the city.

words.definition: When someone is stern, they are very serious and strict.
words.example: The teacher gave the students a stern warning.

words.definition: To stitch is to use a needle and thread to join pieces of cloth.
words.example: My mother stitched the hole in my shirt.

words.definition: A thump is the sound of a heavy object hitting something else.
words.example: I heard a loud thump coming from upstairs.

words.definition: When someone is vehement, they are very passionate or intense.
words.example: He was vehement in his opposition to the new law.
